Yellowtail is quite the luxurious setting which is quite fitting considering the fact that it's within the grand Bellagio casino.  The decor was upscale, but trendy at the same time.  In addition to the extravagant decor inside Yellowtail, you're also spoiled with an absolutely breathtaking view of the famous Fountains of Bellagio.

First off, I acknowledge that eating at Yellowtail comes with a premium.  And I already expected the increase in price from eating in Boston compared to eating in Vegas.  With those two factors in mind, I still found the prices a little on the high side.  Normally I'd be fine with paying a premium for high quality sushi, but for the price in Vegas and the sushi I got... I felt like the price I was paying was more for the surroundings and the location.  I found the dishes to be on the smaller size, but it's all about quality, not quantity.  Still would have liked to get a little more bang for my buck. Here are some of the rolls I tried:

Big Eye Tuna Pizza - Micro Shiso, Truffle Oil
Simply put, this thing is amazing and unique.  It's a stark contrast from the soft delicious tuna and the crunchy pizza crust.  It just all worked, very clean flavors.

Kobe Beef Tataki - Spicy Daikon, Garlic, Maldon Sea Salt
The Kobe Beef is cut paper thin, but it's the combination with the crunch of the garlic and the sea salt that makes this dish a sure winner.  Melts in your mouth.

Tai Snapper - Extra Virgin Olive Oil, Shiso, Tosazu
The extra virgin olive oil makes this dish divine.  The slight peppery taste gives the snapper a nice little kick.  Excellent stuff.

Toro Scallion Roll - Blue Fin Tuna Belly, Green Onion
On the small side, but a classic combination.  Fish was nice and fresh, rice was perfect.  Nothing special, just very solid.

Popping Spicy Crab Roll - Cucumber, Asparagus, Pop Rocks
Amazing and unique roll.  Yes, the description does say Pop Rocks.  Most unique roll I may have ever had.

Great food, good attention to the quality of fish used. But, not the 'magical' experience I'd expect. The price wasn't bad, although it's definitely above what you'd pay at your local sushi restaurant - but it's Vegas, what do you expect?

All in all, an good place with GREAT service.
Awesome restaurant.  Love the tuna pizza.  Tammy was a great waitress.  All the food is very good.  Recommend the cod and tuna.  Get a table so u can see the fountain show.  Spicy edame is very good.

The size of the hamachi nigiri was minuscule!  The Lobster Handroll looked like a burrito born prematurely, (three teeny, tiny bites)!  The Tuna roll pieces were the size of quarters!  Was the sushi chef on a binge?  The green tea was $8 a pot...get the picture?  The check was $75!  It's shocking the Bellagio has such an inferior sushi bar.  I don't care how much they pay for a fish.  It's not showing in the presentation of the sushi.  How do they stay in business!  Our server was excellent.  The decor lovely.  But, the alligator covered chairs were worn and in need of refurbishing.
Service is good... but the food is just average... nothing that really stands out as really good... but nothing that tastes bad either...

I am a bit suprised by 4-5 star reviews - the place left me hungry and broke. We ordered the famed strawberry roll, that has unagi and strawberry, but it was cut paper thin ( for sushi) and cost close to $25. Coctails were really watered down, but good thing that there was "FIX" across the street.

Ok the food here was seriously BOMB.com...would've been 5 stars except for:
~Portions were very (I mean VERY) small
~It was my 21st birthday..we spent 400$+ on a b-day dinner..and no free little song and dance?!?!?! WTF

But I mean I ordered the sweet ginger cigar shrimp, the lobster roll, and the seaweed salad. All were amazing.
Excellent selection of Sake..avoid the 14$ "cocktails" that were 99% juice.
I also tried my friends Unagi and Banana roll..sooo good.
Kobe Beef is incredible.
Pretty much everything I tried was the best I've tasted, and I would DEF reccomend.

Beautiful venue and incredible staff.

Well as with all the Strip sushi joints the quality of food is awesome, service is awesome . I ate at the bar and the bartenders are great, but I just can't justify the portions and the prices can't give this more than a 3 star because of those reasons.
Delicious, fresh sushi with amazing service. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful-- definitely recommend eating here!

Came here for date night and they sat us right at the window by the fountains. The service was impeccable from entrance to end. Arnold and his staff is amazing! Create a wonderful experience for us. The tuna pizza I could eat everyday for the rest of my life. The food does not disappoint!

Yellowtail is to impress.  Yourself, your date or your mama.  The decor, atmosphere and service are all up to upscale balla diner snuff.  You are here because you have fat bankroll, a generous sponsor and/or you're very very beautiful.  Unlike some of the more hip upscale places, there weren't any goofy spikey haired mtv types, which is a good thing.

Although I normally evaluate the value of a place, it is difficult to do since I did not see the bill and probably if you are worried about getting your money's worth, you might as well just get a $14 cocktail and enjoy the atmosphere before grabbing a cab and having a giant feast on Spring Mountain for the same price as your cocktail.

We had spicy tuna rolls, flat iron kobe beef, beef tataki, seaweed salad, miso soup, halibut sashima (I think), potstickers, big eye tuna pizza (a surprising dish!), lobster bowl and some weird roll with pop rocks in them.  I made sure that I got full by adding a bowl of rice to my order.  Portions were generally tiny, though aside from the pop rocks, every dish was excellent.  Even the miso soup was done right.  Normally, I am a little bit more aware of the food, but I was a little buzzed and didn't have my inner yelp critic active.  Since they don't publish the menu nor do I have a receipt, I can't remember the exact dish names.

As a practical matter, if you are on a date here, try your best not to get whiplash.  The ladies are out in force here.  If you are here with the guys, then get a table in the waiting area instead of the inner restaurant.  It's the best view in the house.

Finally, a shout out to our generous sponsor.  I doubt that I would have tried this place without 'em.

We were going to see a show last night and were running short of time. The staff got our meals out very quickly. We ordered four plates between two people and that was more than enough. Good is of exceptional quality

Well I think this restaurant is growing long in the tooth as is the hotel in which it resides.  The food isn't bad, just not the "knock your socks off" taste as it once was.  It seems the prices go up and the quality is starting to go down. 

I will say the waiter/waitress staff are the best.

My wife and I visited Yellowtail with friends of ours while in Vegas on vacation recently. We were all staying at the Bellagio, so this was a great place as far as convenience goes. I was able to place my reservation online using the mLife portal.

Let me start by saying Yellowtail is expensive. If you're looking to have dinner/drinks for a party of four, prepare to spend about $75-100 per person.

That being said, Yellowtail is also very delicious! We started by ordering some small plates (Gyoza, Edamame, Ceviche) which were shared. The Gyoza came out hot and crispy on the bottom, they were very full of flavor. The Ceviche is served with five fried wonton "chips" to use, and was very flavorful and had a strong citrus backing. The Edamame comes out served two ways, one small bowl with traditional steam and another tossed with a Chili Sauce. Trust me when I say this, get the Chili Sauce! It's FANTASTIC!

For our meal we ordered an assortment of sushi rolls, sashimi and nigiri. We had several special requests for preparation of these rolls and they were followed well. As other reviewers have said, the Crispy Kalbi is very special. Korean short ribs and slaw as a role? Sounds crazy, but it works!

So is Yellowtail overpriced? Yes, obviously ($14 for a 12oz can of Japanese Beer, for example). But show me one restaurant located in a casino that isn't. If you're willing to overlook the price, it's actually a really fantastic Sushi restaurant and fun dining experience.

I was disappointed after my recent visit to Yellowtail.  We ordered the scallops (which were AMAZING) as our appetizer and several rolls for our dinner.  When our drinks were brought mine was fine but my date had to ask the waiter for an extra shot of rum because his drink just tasted like soda (they brought it and didn't charge us, which was nice). The rolls came out very quickly but no scallops - the waiter said everything on the menu is an appetizer so they just bring out whatever comes up first.  That was weird to me.  The rolls (we ordered three different ones) were just blah, no decoration or sauce on the plate and we had to ask for soy sauce. The whole experience was just meh - our server seemed like he was losing his mind although it was a very slow night in the restaurant.  Someone who may have been the manager did check on us at least three times after the drink incident.  All in all, uninspiring rolls, weak drinks, way too expensive.

Shared the big eye tuna pizza, happa roll, tempura Alaskan king crab, and seaweed salad. I enjoyed it all. My favorite was the pizza because I love truffle anything, but the tempura crab and happa roll were excellent as well. My husband wasn't a fan of the pizza, but he loved the other 2 items, and he's not a big sushi guy. The happa roll had a little kick in the sauce provided. The seaweed salad was mediocre, just like any other seaweed salad at any other sushi joint, save yourself $9 on that. We stuck to water, so can't comment on the beverages. Waitstaff was courteous, on point with checking on us and refilling our water, and helpful with the menu items as we were newbies. Over all a great experience, and I'd say worth the money.

Visited Yellowtail twice during a 5 day stay in Vegas.  We usually stay at the Bellagio but because my husband does not eat sushi or fish of any kind, this isn't a restaurant I would pick for the two of us. However, we were meeting a friend who is a local and said we had to go.  We did and my husband was an instant fan.  A lot of their items are a shared plate (warm and cold) as well as the rolls, etc.  My friend and I shared the tuna pizza which is excellent!  It consists of a toasted tortilla (whole wheat I think) with thinly sliced red onion, some sort of white sauce and then the tuna on top.  Delish!  We also had the yellow tail which was good (a nice light fish).  My favorite was the king crab tempura.  To top things off we had a spicy tuna roll.  We would have loved to try more but there is only so much you can eat.  My husband had the aged Kobe beef flat iron steak which was sliced and served with a teriyaki sauce on top of some root vegetables.  He ordered this the 2nd time we were there as well but ordered a bowl of rice since he felt he needed a bit more to eat since he passed on sharing our plates.

The hostess was great, she remembered us right away.  There was one hostess (not at the desk) that sat us and she was not friendly at all but that did not detract from our night.  The waitstaff was so friendly and when we asked for suggestions, they were spot-on.

I loved the whole ambience of this type of restaurant. First off, it overlooks the fountains at the bellagio.  The restaurant is small so make your reservations.  The music that played, the design, all great.

the best place to watch the bellagio fountain show?  at one of bellagios fountainside restaurants.  we made a reservation at yellowtail the day of dining and had no problem.  they gave us a table outside and while eating we saw three fountain shows as the sunset.  definitely the best views of the strip ever.

yellowtail serves sushi for a very high price.  and as the food came we joked that we had to go to mcdonalds afterwards.  we ordered the big eyed tuna pizza which the server said was the most popular.  it had truffle oil and was pretty good.  bascially tuna on crackers.  i had seaweed salad - nothing spectacular here except the price.  and also a clear soup - again nothing spectacular.  thei lobster carpaccio is not raw.  the lobster has been poached.

they have this really high energy sommelier/sake specialist (?)  

for dessert mochi and tempura ice cream.  a bigger ball of ice cream would given us more ice cream after frying.  we got a lot of melted vanilla ice cream on our plate.  i never order mochi because its not like they make it.  they just buy it and put it on a plate and charge us much more.

and for the record we did have to eat after this.

Big eye tuna pizza! Sooooo good. It's one of the best sushi dishes I have ever had.

The rock shrimp and the roll with the pop rocks in it are also a must. 

This is one of our favorite restaurants for not only the food, but the view. If it is not the dead of summer, request to sit on the patio. At night, the fountain goes off every 15 minutes and there is not better seat than the balcony at yellowtail.

The food and service here are amazing. My husband and I took some visiting international friends here for drinks and then dinner. We sat in the lounge and wanted to try some new cocktails. Our server, Jill, recommended some excellent drinks and to this day my husband says it's the best cocktail he's ever had. Then we decided to order some food and again the recommendations were perfect. Everything we ordered, we loved including the Lobster Carpaccio. One of our friends doesn't love sushi as much as the rest of us but loved this dish. Not only were the food and drinks excellent, but Jill was so attentive, enthusiastic and knowledgable. We had a wonderful time. It was the perfect experience to share with our friends.
Loved the ahi pizza with truffle oil, popping crab roll is great too. Location was great, sat outside by fountains- menu was great. Service was great, can't wait to go again
This trendy sushi place serves fresh, delicious cuisine that is unique and very Vegas. Loved it!

I love sushi. It's probably my favorite type of cuisine. I'd say I'm a sushi snob. Yellowtail is in my top 5 favorite sushi spots. I didn't try any menu items from the kitchen so I can't rate them on that but the nigiri and sashimi were extremely fresh and "buttery" (melts in your mouth). My husband and I celebrated our 2nd anniversary in vegas and we had dinner here at yellowtail before our cirque du soleil show.  They set up a private table on their small balcony (it could only fit a table for 2) overlooking the fountains.  It was dusk so the lighting was perfect.  The noise was minimal.  We had most of the nigiri on the menu - from hamachi (yellowtail) to toro (tuna belly) to uni (sea urchin).  It's so hard to find fresh uni and yellowtail had the best!  I swear I could taste the ocean, it was so fresh!  The waiter said they had just been flown in from japan (not sure if he this was true but I didn't care b/c it was delicious).  I could have eaten a dozen!  Overall the service was great - we had an informative and attentive server.  I would definitely go back for the sushi!

I can't rave enough about this restaurant! I am not a fan of raw fish and/or sushi but I seriously ate everything my table ordered! It was so fresh, delicious, and paired well. We had the lobster carpaccio that was my favorite as well as one of their rolls which has pop rocks in it so it gives a unique experience! The short rib roll with Cole slaw piled on top was fantastic! Def a must to stop by!

If you are looking for real Japanese food, yellowtail is not the right place. Food definitely not made by some one who knows Japanese food. I was there for the food not for the view, so it only worth 1 star. Very pricy for what they sell. E.g. California roll cost $17. Very limited selection. I bid the owner is not a Japanese.

I love Japanese food and this restaurant does not disappoint. Low lighting and a beautiful view of the fountains which give the room a great ambience. The waiters are wonderful, attentive and encouraged some great menu choices. The food is a modern take on Japanese cuisine with some unusual combinations that work so well. The stand out dishes for me and my personal favorites are the tuna pizza and the pop rock roll.  Overall Yellowtail is fantastic, the location in unbeatable, the food is phenomenal and the service completely blows you away. I will absolutely dine here again, and highly recommend to anyone who comes to vegas this is a must!

First off, we came here in an elaborate scheme for my cousin to propose to his girlfriend.  We're friends with some staff thus they opened up the patio (which was closed that night) for us during the water show so that he could propose.  It was quite a picturesque scene.  The staff was very friendly and accomodating and got us comped into the bank nightclub afterwards.  Awesome.

The food - we were all still pretty full from the paris champagne brunch so we ordered light.  I got their signature banana unagi roll and strawberry roll (it has pop rocks on top!)  The banana roll was impressive as the banana flavor was evident but not overwhelming.  And no whack filler like cream cheese!  My friend ordered salmon sashimi, but it was smaller than my pinkie finger.  I felt bad for him, but otherwise, a great night and venue.
Seriously fantastic food. The kind that hits every hpt button.  Awesome view,  too. I would definitely come back.

We dined two nights in a row at our stay in Bellagio. Prices are high and portions are on the modest side, but everything we ordered was delicious. I recommend the scallop tiradito, yellowtail jalapeño, salmon new style sashimi, and my favorite, the toro Bluefin tuna belly (fresh)! I loved the kick in the spicy Miso soup and the crab was a great compliment to it- the rock shrimp were yummy also. Ask for some sriracha to use as dipping sauce. Service was impeccable...we had a rotation of servers taking care of us and checking on us both visits. Ambiance is dark lit, intimate, swanky on the inside. Thanks yellowtail

So I cannot speak for the food, but the mixed drinks are DELICIOUS!  My coworker and I liked it so much that we came here two nights before they closed.  I loved their Lychee cocktail, and my coworker liked their Blood Orange cocktail (sorry, I forget the official name). We each loved our drink enough the first night to re-order it on our second visit. We also tried their cucumber cocktail, which was great as well.  The trade off was the cost - our drinks cost $20 each.   But better one expensive cocktail than 2 or 3 horrible cheap ones!

The service here was great too.  The waitress we had on the first night was great - kind and quick to help us. The bartender on the second visit was also friendly and nice to chat with.

If you are walking through the Bellagio and looking for a drink, stop here.  You won't regret it!

This place is so expensive but also so good! Probably one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. I always leave this place satisfied and wanting more and with a hole in my wallet lol. Well, technically I'm not the one paying but you know what I mean. Last time we came with the party of 8 and the tab came out to be around $1,600 including tax and tip. 

Let's talk about the setting of the restaurant. It's located in the casino of Bellagio. It's next to the fountain. If you get seat by balcony like we did, you get to experience the fountain show from inside the hotel. It's a completely different feeling than experiencing it on the Strip. It's much closer that way and you can enjoy it without being in a huge crowd of people. As you'd expect from a high end restaurant, the setting inside is fancy. It's dim a little giving sense of romanticness, so it's a perfect place to take your date. 

The food. There large selection of food and honestly they're all great. Though these are my personal favorites: tuna pizza, yellowtail, flat iron steak, ribeye, and Scottish salmon. 

-The tuna pizza is a thinly sliced pizza served with raw tuna on top. I thought it was an interesting combination at first. I mean, raw tuna on pizza? Does that even go together? Oh man, let me tell you, it does. And it does great. It has the soft and juiciness of the tuna and the crunchiness of the pizza. This was our party's favorite and we just kept ordering these. They come at $29 a plate though. 
-The yellowtail has got to the best yellowtail I've eaten. My go to food at most Japanese restaurants is grilled yellowtail cheek, so I've tasted plenty of yellowtails, but this is honestly the best one I've tasted. Well I mean you'd expect it to be good, afterall it's the name of the restaurant. The fish is juicy and soft and just melt in your mouth. It's not dry like some places. 
-I'm going to review the ribeye and flat iron together. They were both great. The quality of beef is excellent and it's super soft. However my only complaint was that they were a little burnt. Maybe the chef was a little off today, but the outside of the beef were a tad bit burnt. This wasn't the case with my previous visits. Aside from that it tastes heavenly. 
-The Scottish salmon also tastes great. Not much to say about it. Just your average salmon, but they just somehow seasoned it and made it taste so good. Maybe the chef used his secret sauce or something? ;) lol jk but seriously it's good.

The best thing about this restaurant is our waiter Roberto. The sushi was fresh and delicious. Nice table near the window and a perfect view of the water show!  Beautiful restaurant however the music choices did not match the upscale ambience.
I had Omakase and the food is contemporary Japanese. Sushi was good and the sirloin was soft as it can be. The chef delivered every dish and explained the ingredients.

Let me start by saying that if I could give no stars, I would after the "customer service" experience we had.  

If you read any part of this review, read this:  

GROUP FOOD POISONING AND HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.


I had been planning a really special bachelorette weekend for my best friend of 22 yrs for months and of course I wanted every bit of it to be just perfect as a wedding is a once-in-a-lifetime experience and arguably the most important time in a woman's life.

We flew into Vegas from NYC on July 18, 2013 and wanted to have a big dinner and rest our first night before celebrating the following 3 days.  

I chose Yellowtail as the Bellagio would be a change of scenery (we stayed at the Cosmopolitan which by the way is AMAZING), and because it is a 5-Star property at which one would THINK they would be dining in a trustworthy, luxury place.

We ordered many dishes to share including tuna pizza, different sushi rolls, eggplant, shrimp tempura, beef and more.  

There were 6 of us in our party.  One of the girls  is vegetarian, so of course she did not partake in any of the seafood dishes.  Nor did I, as I don't eat fish. A 7th girl joined us in Vegas the following day, so she did not dine at Yellowtail. 

THIS IS THE ONLY THING WE DID DIFFERENTLY FROM EACH OTHER THE ENTIRE FIRST DAY OF OUR TRIP which is how we know that the food poisoning came directly from Yellowtail.

The next morning, all 4 girls INCLUDING THE BRIDE, who ate the fish & sushi came down with debilitating food poisoning symptoms.  Vomiting and other issues that I'm sure I don't need to spell out, kept them literally lying on the hotel bathroom floor for the remainder of our trip. The poor things were hardly able to stand and we were thankful that we had a suite with multiple bathrooms or we would have been in an even worse state.

Our trip, and more importantly, the Bride's special weekend (and more--this food poisoning spell triggered her to experience vertigo which she is still suffering from to this day), were COMPLETELY RUINED.  The girls spent all day and night feeling like they literally might die, and the 3 of us who did not experience the symptoms , were force feeding them Gatorade and toast so that they wouldn't be hospitalized in Las Vegas with dehydration.

7 girls, 7 RUINED trips. 

We couldn't do any of the fun things we had planned and wasted a lot of money and time that we will never be able to get back.

We called the Bellagio right away to put in a complaint thinking that they would AT THE VERY LEAST, refund our dinner bill as a courtesy for our extreme inconvenience.  

Instead, they proceeded to give us the run-around for weeks, passing us off from department to department--Security to "Guest Services," to the restaurant itself, to the Light Group (who owns the restaurant), etc., and ultimately we were told that they would not be taking ANY responsibility and that we were basically sh*t out of luck. 

DO NOT EAT HERE.  Vegas has so many amazing and accommodating places to dine, and so many fun things to experience. Don't ruin your trip by eating at this irresponsible establishment.

I would NOT eat here again.  The food way way too expensive for what we got.  We ordered a bottle of wine and I felt we got regular casino everyday glassware.   I would expect a nice expensive restaurant to have decent glasses not a glass you would receive while gambling or something.    

The tuna pizza was good but presentation rather boring.  We also ordered Kumamoto oysters which was about $32 for 6 and it was not anywhere near Asian inspired I felt like it was something I would have got at an Italian place.   Oysters and cocktail sauce is basically what we got.   We ordered the filet toban as well which smelled awesome but was nothing special.   The crispy kalbi roll was delicious but presentation was lacking!!!!  

Now I don't mind spending money on my meal if the food and presentation and service was great but I wasn't really happy when I left.  The service was rushed and she didn't really listen to us, plus she kept telling us that was probably enough food in which was not and felt that she didn't have time for us.   Maybe she just wanted us to leave.  We were helped by another man who was dressed in a chef coat who was not the chef but was helping out he said and he was very personable and helpful more than our server was.  She kinda disappear towards the end.

I Have high expectations for a restaurant in Bellagio and was highly disappointed.

Food was ok...service lacking....and food presentation pretty plain.  Prices should be much lower for the quality of everything.    Even a sushi roll was between 20 and 30 which is fine is it's exceptional.

If you're looking for delicious Asian food Andreas at Wynn or chada Thai near China town is great and you get what you pay for!

The one star is for the incredibly hot hostesses. Other than that, Yellowtail is just another trendy flop.  Service was not consistent. For some reason, the servers would not take empty plates away. They just kept squeezing new dishes on to the table.  The food was very very disappointing. I wasn't  expecting much, but what we got was disappointing.  Don't really want to get into the details and bash every dish but I do suggest that this place is a nice lounge/bar, but don't waste your time with the food.

Dined in at yellowtail a few days ago and we had the most amazing time. Our server Tammy was so helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. She directed us into ordering the tuna pizza which is the most delicious thing i have ever eaten. We also had the lobster carpaccio and filet toban. We also had the divine droplet sake and it was amazing! Make sure to eat at yellowtail if you are in vegas and ask for Tammy! You will definitely enjoy your experience! Very Nice view too!!!

Pop rock sushi?! Say whaaaaaaaaaaaaaat.
I just had to try it while I was visiting Las Vegas. It was basically a spicy tuna roll with pop rocks, really original and actually tasted pretty darn good.
The other pleasant surprise of the evening was the Big Eye Tuna Pizza. It is topped with truffle oil, YUM!
Ended up spending a pretty penny that night, but definitely had some delicious and originial food.
I say it's worth a shot if your are looking for a nice date night in Vegas.

Ive debated even reviewing this restaurant (as I only had a glass of wine, and two apps of edamame), but decided I should. 

My friend had some sort of sushi, and really enjoyed it. And my edamame apps (I believe I had one with sea salt, and one with a chili sauce) were very good (how can you go wrong with edamame??). But wow this place is expensive. Very very very expensive. For two glasses of their cheapest wine, two edamame apps, and a sushi plate, our bill with tip was about $100. 

Sorry that this isn't the most informative review about the service and atmosphere (see other reviews for that), but I can't justify spending the amount of money this place requests... even in Vegas.

Last week, I wanted to end my trip at Vegas happy, but I was met with udder disappointment. Me and my girlfriend was served by Team 1. 

They had highly disorganized team. We wanted a few minutes to look over the menu and the server never came back to us. Instead another server came and took our order. We only ordered 3 items since we only had about 2 hrs before meeting up with friends.

After our order was taken, the previous server came back and asked if we ordered. We told her we did and waited another 15 minute before we were served with Braised Kobe beef short ribs. 

Honestly, it tasted like something my dad could make for 1/3 of the cost. Wasn't impressed, but the next item that came did taste amazing. The Seared Diver Sea Scallops tasted Amazing! It was cooked perfectly and practically melted in your mouth.

Here is where I have trouble understanding your service. I had to wait 30 minutes for the Big Eye Tuna Pizza. A cold dish. There was 3 servers that came over and asked me if I wanted to order more. Did it look like I was happy sitting there with no food on the table? I asked one server to check on it and she never came back. The second one actually checked on it and told me it's almost ready. The third one obviously wasn't told that people were working on it already. 

It then took another 10 minutes to get the check. Is it because we came in late around 9:30? Is everyone rushing to get off work, so we end up getting a few minutes per server?

So the main reason I'm giving this place a 2 star rating is because of the horrible service.

My wife and I enjoyed our time at yellowtail on 9/29/2014. The environment is amazing. Highly recommend  dinner for two reserved and seated outside to have the view of Bellagio water show. We had sushi and steak. The sushi was fresh, but the Kobe steak was not really hot and it felt like was placed under the cold lamp instead of hot lamp. The rib eye was tasty I would recommend that over Kobe. My wife ended up eating half of my rib eye and I did not mind switching with her. Over all good experience and if you first timer to see the water show that is a good dinning.

Food was amazing and the waiter (Theo) and most of the staff was great! The star is being knocked because of the hostesses who were rude and came across as pompous...

We had a reservation for 6pm but seemed that we could have been seated just as fast without it! The food is some of the best sushi you will find, expect to pay $$$ since you are on the strip in Las Vegas AND at the Bellagio but that doesn't knock a star, just the rude hostesses!! 

One of the best dishes is the Big Eye Tuna Pizza!! The Happa roll was great and all the fish in everything was fresh! The braised short rib also was fantastic!

First let me say, I have eaten here before, and have been here when it's super busy.  We were seated within 5 minutes which was a good start but it went downhill from there.  It took the server quite awhile to bring out our drinks.  Then we waited over 20 minutes for our edamame.  After 30 minutes of waiting for 2 sushi rolls (we were just getting a snack), I finally was able to get our server over to our table and ask what was going on.  Her response was that they were really busy; which was not the case.  Let me also say, once we had our drinks, she NEVER came back to our table.  Our food was brought to us by runners, and our server never even came back to see if we wanted another cocktail.  I have to say the food was excellent, as usual, and also very overpriced but I knew that going in.  I give the food a 4, the price a 2 and the service a 1.  Overall for me, terrible experience.

Dinner after a show.
The concierge highly recommended this place so we tried it even though some reviews had red flags.
Service- just ok
Ambience- very cool
Food- average to good. The tuna pizza was delicious. Rock shrimp- not original and the tempura batter was undercooked and chewy, yellowtail jalapeño - very average and portion size laughable
Prices- ridiculous  
We've been to many excellent and original asian and asian-fusion restaurants. Yellowtail is trying too hard and charging too much.
Won't go back

It's at the Bellagio, and obviously it was going to be kinda expensive. The food was GREAT but the service was so bad that the whole thing was painful. You could see that they hired the servers for their looks only. She was pretty but didn't have much of anything going on inside her head. It was NOT busy at all and she took 15 minutes to refill waters after we asked, and we had to ask for our bill twice and then get up and ask at the hostess stand for it. Ridiculous.

I got the tuna pizza based on her recommendation since she said it's what they were known for. It was delicious. My bf's chicken meal was crazy good too and he loved it. It's too bad that our meal was tainted by her horrible service. Also, they don't give free refills, so she ended up charging us almost $10 for his 3 sodas. Really?

I've been to Yellowtail a few times, including twice in the past month.  My experience has been great every time.  Both times I recently went we sat right next to a window overlooking the Bellagio fountains and the food and service were both phenomenal.  

I've had the edamame, big eye tuna pizza, the Alaskan king crab tempura, the popping spicy crab aka pop rocks roll, and the filet mignon toban.  

The sweet chili that was added to the edamame made it very delicious.  The big eye tuna pizza is a dish that is an absolute must try.  It's difficult to describe the burst of flavor when you bite into it a piece, but it's excellent.  The crab tempura was fried to perfection and went really well with the sauces they served it with.  The spicy crab roll was unique because of the pop rocks they add to it.  The filet mignon melted in my mouth.  I also had a dessert that was made from nutella that was amazing.  I don't remember what it was called (dessert in a cup maybe?), but I would recommend it as well.  The overall quality of the food is good enough to justify the price you pay for it.  

I would definitely call in advance and make a reservation.  Also, a lot of people dress up to eat here, but the atmosphere and vibe is laid back and relaxed enough that you can wear relatively casual attire and not feel under-dressed.

I love love loved this place. It was amazing. The food was really good but the view was wow!! Perfect romantic dinner to go to. Sitting in the patio and having the Bellagio fountains go on every 15 min or so with beautiful music was just so nice. The ink reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the hosts in the front. When I made reservations and requested outside they never mentioned that it's not a guaranteed seating so when I got there they made it a big deal. In any case we waited a little and they did find us a table to sit in the patio and I had a great time. O and it's pretty pricy but usually you get for what you pay!

Very rude waiter.... I couldn't believe it. My husband and I came there to celebrate him returning from a deployment and the waiter didn't even care to really mention anything. Also, the sushi was very delicious but wayyy overpriced. 

I would say I'm pleased I came here once to try out the food and that main fact that we had an amazing view of the fountain show at the bellagio-- but otherwise we will not be coming back here again.

Best miso soup I've EVER had, great service, a little pricey (obvi - it's in the Bellagio). Rolls were really fresh but on the smaller side, but we really enjoyed them. Decor is appealing, too. I'd recommend it!

Sleek contempary room with good people viewing seats within the Forum shops rotunda.  Very good sushi, very good service, reasonable prices by Vegas standards.  Worth a visit if you are in a sushi mood.

Had a reservation with another couple.   Waited 40 minutes.  After receiving no updates from the rude, disinterested hostesses we finally left.   Considering they are located in the bellagio I was shocked by how they could careless about their customers.   Not up to the bellagio standard - they should refrain the staff there - every other dealing with bellagio stores and restaurants was perfect.    Try Lagos across the way  in bellagio - wow they are amazing!!!!!

This is my first Yelp review.  The poor value of a "meal" at this restaurant bothered me so much, it prompted me to join Yelp and share.  The eggplant skewers were good ($12).  We also ordered a spicy tuna roll ($13) and a roast chicken entree ($28).  Such tiny portions.  The tuna roll was a joke.  We stared at it for a good 30 seconds when it arrived.  The chicken entree literally came with 1 small carrot, 1 small piece of asparagus, and 1 pearl onion.  We do not have big appetites but the portion size here just did not justify the price.  Service was good but looked confused when we mentioned the portions seemed small in relation to the price.  So $53 for what amounted to some mediocre appetizers.  Poor value.  Nothing Special.  Sad that anyone would think this place is great.  There is so much more in Vegas and beyond that is better regardless of price.

The food was pretty good, but our service was so appalling I had to take off three stars.

We go to Yellowtail on a friend's recommendation. It's myself, 7 other students, and a professor in town for a convention. After a lot of deliberation our waiter suggests letting him order, saying it'll be a good way to try the menu as well as making the price reasonable for us. He asks for our preferences so he can understand our tastes, and two of the students say they like California rolls - which should indicate to him their tastes are pretty basic. 

We get one round. Four plates, all different, and share. It's kind of cool we think. Then another round comes out, two orders of two items. Then another. And another. Progressively going up the menu. 

After about our 5th round the waiter tells us everything he ordered is in and now we just need to wait for the rest to come out. After this, two orders of a $60 dish come out. Then more rolls. Then two orders of a $130 dish come out. At this point, everyone is full and wondering why this waiter has ordered us so much food. Food that some people can't even enjoy because it's too eclectic for their tastes. Another order comes out. Then another, four rolls that are barely touched because everyone is so full. 

We've barely touched that order before the next thing comes out. Luckily someone says "No. We're done eating." Afterwards our waiter comes over, leans into the ear of the girl who organized our dinner and somewhat snarkily says "Just so you know... Well, nevermind." And walks off. Then we get the bill.

Our bill is about $1300 and our waiter has guaranteed himself about a $200 tip because of the automatic gratuity placed on tables of 8 or more. 

Our server took advantage of us. He knew we were young students. He knew we were indecisive about our tastes. He knew that amount of food was way too much. And yet, he put in at least 11 courses of food, possibly more. 

Why wouldn't he place 3 courses, ask if we would like more of what we had or if he's matching our tastes, then continue? Why would he place THAT MANY orders at once?

The service here completely ruined my faith in Yellowtail. Between being shoved in the back and having to wait forever to get refills on drinks and our experience with a waiter who knew he ordered too much food that was too expensive for a group of 20-22 year olds and a professor, likely because of an automatic gratuity, I don't know if I can return. If your waiter is a tall man with glasses and closely cropped hair, do not let him order for your group.

If, despite reading how they treat their customers, you decide to est at Yellowtail anyway, give the tuna pizza a try. That and a few other dishes are slightly redeeming qualities of this restaurant, but I'll never forget the way their staff abused the trust of myself and my peers.

maybe I was just really really really hungry but everything we ordered was good. They offer a shared plate type of menu so its perfect for a medium sized to large group. Somehow even though everyone seems to complain about the price when we got the bill and figured out the price per person it wasnt bad at all. Dont expect to stuff yourself like your at Duffs buffet and you will do well. ...... Sushi pizza

WOW! This is one of the best meals I have had in a very long time. The tuna pizza, the yellowtail, the steak... and O yea, the dessert. 

this is a must visit

If there was a negative 100 star button I would click that! THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER!
We specifically requested NO shellfish and they brought  the shellfish out in our roll and we had a horrible experience and swelling of the face and more side effects! It's a shame how customers are treated these days! They only took 1 dessert off after spending over 350+ dollars there. And now need medical attention for the mistake the waitress made

We decided to eat at Yellowtail after a long stroll up and down the strip..me and my girls were craving sushi so we stopped in (and the line for The Buffet @ Bellagio was loonnnnggg). The restaurant wasnt too crowded and our waitress was super cute. First, we ordered the Spicy Miso Soup....if you like spicy food-order it and thank me later. That soup brought tears to my eyes but did it stop me...Hell no! There was also bits of shrimp and seaweed and the soup but honestly I expected more soup for $8.00.

Next, we ordered spicy tuna sushi and it was pretty good-the tuna, rice and seaweed was pretty fresh. No complaints there but nothing spectacular either. Last but not least, I ordered the Edamame and it comes 2 ways...Salted and with a Sweet coating...pretty appetizing...very different. Finally, we washed it all down with our $4.50 glass of Coca Cola....(hey its Vegas...whats a $4.50 soda). 

We had a pretty good experience here at Yellowtail....I actually had better sushi at a strip mall in VA but, hey...its Vegas :)

Horrible service!!!! Very rude and pushy waitress. I will never go back.......we were told that she would only take an order from one person!!! She could not be bothered with speaking to the 7 of us. Overpriced and not worth it

As everyone's else commands, I hated this restaurant, the food and presentation for price of it is a NoNo No
 The customer service sucked and the food, what surprised us the most is that they brought both of our order on the same plate and didn't tell us, so we are waiting for the second plate to arrive Nop that was it. Very much not to the standard of Bellogio casino this restaurant service and food  should get better to the 5 star rating or should close down.

I'm having trouble separating Vegas from Yellowtail, but I'll try my best...

The food and ambiance were nice, the service was just eh.  We started with some sparkling sake with blueberry puree.  It was actually really good, seemed like an odd combination at first, but clearly they know more about these things than I do because it worked quite well.  The sweet chili sauce on the edamame was all very good.  The sushi wasn't anything special.  It was good, but nothing I'd go out of my way for.  

The dining room was very pretty and the ambiance was nice.  It's Vegas, if they can't make you comfortable in a restaurant then you're in the wrong place.  Considering the prices you're paying I expect a comfortable dining experience.  Overlooking the Bellagio fount is a nice addition to a dinner.  I have a hard time calling anything in Vegas "romantic" but I suppose this should be deemed a romantic restaurant.  

Seems like the place was crawling with staff, every direction you look there's a server or hostess descending on you.  It was a little on the annoying side, but the food and drinks made up for it. 

Overall, it was pretty good.  If you're looking for good sushi on the strip Yellowtail is a good place to start your search.

Visited here yesterday after catching show.  Great inner terrace for people watching. Wait staff were really nice and attentive.  The food we ordered was good flavor...but portions were sooooo small. This is not for the light walleted...just being real. Don't expect to get full at all.  We had filet minion app(four bites each) , Rock shrimp roll (equated to 2 yes 2 pieces of sushi), plum wine (which came in a short glass), and a bloody mary....this came up to 120. 

Got the experience and then went and got a hamburger  lol.

Nothing was bad here, but it's hard to recommend it for any particular reason. It was fine, but rather expensive. For a date, the dark setting might be nice, but for a family gathering, I didn't particularly care for it. The food was fine, and the service was average. They quickly took a reservation on Saturday night for a large party and seated us promptly, which was nice.

They have some very tasty unique dishes here that are worth coming back.  The tuna sushi pizza is to die for.  I have eaten here four times and get it every time.  The yellowtail blood orange carpaccio is also very tasty.  Lastly, the king crab tempura with ponzu is also divine.

When dining at the Bellagio, I'm aiming for a 4 or 5 star experience.  This was way below expectations! The service was extremely spotty.  
We had a large party, and I do understand if certain mistakes are made during busy hours.  However, they weren't super crowded.  Took a while for everything to come out.  What I really disliked the most was the waiter dropping off everything at certain spots of the table.  If you're a fancy sushi restaurant, wouldn't you at least know or remember who ordered which food and where it went? Also, there was clearly timing issues, and dishes came out one or two at a time.  For a large party, some people had to watch others eat.  It just amazed me how they dropped off the food, and since we were a large party, it took a while to determine who had ordered it.... And the waiter was pretty clueless also! The food itself was pricy, yet it was decent. The edamame was good, as it was well seasoned.  Besides that, definitely not worth it.  I would only go here again if I was forced to... If not, definitely visit other sushi places on the strip!!
My fourth Yellowtail visit and I continue to have amazing dishes and great service. Love!!
Favorite thing to do on the strip is get a table on the terrace and watch the fountains and eat Brussels sprouts.

We went here a few months ago, but I can still remember how amazing the experience it was.  Beautiful environment, the service was fantastic, and the sushi blew us away.

Easily one of my favorite places in Vegas.

YellowFAIL. Overpriced, Pretentious w/ no justification.  $28 for 1 scallop. That's right. One. Waiter was a snot, couldn't get a decent table for anniversary even w/advanced reservations & showing up early. Apparently we didn't know the right suit to fellate. It tries to come off chic but really just sucks. We spent over $100 on dinner (no drinks), & left hungry. Need I say more.

Bumped up to a 5th star on account of a handwritten "Thank You" from our server Mithkah. Whether she knows it or not,  because of her follow up Yellowtail has now moved to the top of my sushi rotation is Vegas.

Owners listen up- those old time service gestures are THE shit! Being nice, friendly and enjoying your job are the keys to success in the service industry. I was going to wait till July to back to Vegas, but now am going next week... for more Yellowtail of course!

Don't go. Save your money and get 2 dinners. The food quality was good, but not great. I've had much better more times than I can remember. For the price I paid, I expected life altering sushi. 

Service was so-so. Hostess forgot to seat us and asked us what we were waiting for. This was 3 minutes after she already said they were preparing our table. 

Don't have the heart to give it a 1 Star because the food didn't suck, but I would advise no one to go to this restaurant.

Baked Crab or Rock Shrimp Hand Roll  w/Crispy Onions, Spicy Aioli, Soy Paper   is delicious!!! I would come here again and again just for this!!  Reordered this because it was that good : )

the seafood dynamite on the other hand, i felt like i was just eating mayonnaise.  It felt really gross and the mayo overwhelmed the taste of everything.

I love this place! The view of the Bellagio Fountains is real nice and I love the dimly lit atmosphere. The food is amazing. You must try the spicy popping crab, I think that is what it is called. It's spicy tuna roll with pop rocks in it. Very interesting, but delicious and fun. The chicken entree is delicious and the kobe beef flat iron is amazing and a must try. Their spicy edamame is real tasty. The place is a little pricey, but the service is excellent.

The "big eye tuna pizza" is incredible, as is everything on the menu. This is not only my favorite sushi restaurant, but my favorite restaurant anywhere in the world, period. And I've been to hundreds of restaurants everywhere from Dubai to Mexico to Melbourne.

I've had almost everything on the menu and most of it is awesome.  The ambiance is poppin and if you're able to get a table for 2 at the window next to the Bellagio fountain show, that's a plus.  Pop rock roll is one of my favorites.

If I could give no stars I would. We were staying at the hotel and wanted to grab some sushi. 
The lady who greeted us spoke so disdainfully to us I was horrified! 
We had a sleeping infant, and were informed we couldn't bring her in, in her stroller. She was asleep and we were told to take her out and put her on a chair if needed! Yeah right! Needless to say, we walked out and ate at sensi across the other side of the hotel! Which was amazing!

Food and service were excellent, but the techno music blasting in an endless loop made it almost impossible to have a conversation and forced us to rush through dinner, leaving with headaches. Maybe just not our scene, but won't be back.

Dined here for the 1st time. Was given a window table with view of Bellagio fountains show. Had the filet mignon roll, spicy crab with POP ROCKS, and red dragon roll. All real good! The roll with the pop rocks was interesting but very good! 

We had the best service from our waiter, Taylor. Really energetic & friendly. The staff was very attentive, always refilling our drinks & checking on us. 

We also had the blackberry cheesecake. That was good.

What an utter waste. We stopped by for a quick meal, and basically had a mediocre light snack for $120. The server was inattentive (and we were sitting at the bar), the food was just okay, we were rushed through our plates with food we were still eating being whisked away, and there was an annoying bathroom attendant in the restroom. I've had twice as much sushi that was twice as good for half the price. If you're being comped knock yourself out, but if you're actually paying for the food go ANYWHERE else. Three and a half star food, one star service, and I have no idea why this place has three dollar signs. A proper dinner for two would run you at least $250 excluding tip.

The restaurant was attractive, but the tall tables were somewhat awkward and uncomfortable. The waitstaff from the hostess to the waitress was very snooty, and provided poor service. The sushi was overpriced, uninspired and not particularly memorable. I've had much better sushi for less money elsewhere.

The chef was good, but the service was horrible. I guess that's better than the other way around. It was empty inside so we had a great view of the Bellagio water show. So if you do come here, make sure you reserve your table outside or near the window to enjoy the ambiance.

Place is really good , but the prices are way too high for what it is . You are paying for the amazing view and the fact that it is at the bellagio hotel . Staff is great and food really good , just the price that was a no go for me for what it is . but if you are rich lol this is the place to go no doubt.

This place I think is better than nobu.  You should go with a nice group so you can get a bunch of plates to share.  The kobe beef tataki melts in your mouth with a nice garlic crunch.  The toro was amazing.  Hot oil seared salmon - again, melts in your mouth.  Most of us got just plates and plates of sashimi and sushi but some got the meat entrees.  The short ribs were great - very tender, fall of the bone, and great flavor.  The salmon was not too heavy (good if u r going clubbing afterwards).  Atmosphere was hip and the service was great.  They have a sake somalier who can help you pick out some nice sake to compliment the food.  I do agree the pop rock thing was kind of weird.

They made a believer out of me. Prior to going here, seafood was a no-no. My dude jokes that I'm a cheap date (so I make up for it by ordering multiple drinks...) but anything fishy seems gross to me. He LOVES sushi, so on our little trip to vegas we had to stop here (it was in our hotel) and didn't end up going to Nobu. ANYWAYS. I actually ate sushi and I LOVED IT. not just fish... RAW FISH!? The service was SUPERB, but then the service at the Bellagio was STELLAR, outrageously good. We had a great night and our server even gave us an honest breakdown of the strip joints we should try (we asked!). Everyone was cool, everyone was nice, the service was out of this world. I definitely recommend it, especially if you love sushi, but even more if you're on the fence about it.

Very nice elegant dining experience. Service was excellent. If you visit here you MUST try the popping spicy crab it was excellent. I also ordered the California roll but it was average and not worth the price. Sticking to traditional cuisine I ordered Sake as a drink, it came in a cool looking possibly bamboo cylinder and was good and smooth, but at around $45 it was only worth the price to share among the table.

I've visited this place the day before yesterday. This is one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, especially for my special day. So nice situation, the window seat after sunset is the best. Please don't miss the big eye tuna pizza and broiled atlantic black cod which is my favorite. I need to add the comment about the service... was wonderful!!! We had a great time with their kind services and smiles. I would love to visit again whenever I could stop by Las Vegas!

First Yelp review, fittingly. @TaylorSwift13 once tweeted "The best meal of my life. Yellowtail in Las Vegas, NV." I live in Las Vegas so I decided to visit Bellagio and try it. Accurate statement t-swizzle! 

I've been here at least 4 times; the most recent visit on 6/28. Attractive hostesses/waitresses, waitstaff team service is top notch, super friendly, and attentive. Every single time. Nice, classy atmosphere and clientele. Everything you should expect in a high-end restaurant business. Phenomenal food. All reasons why I keep coming back for more! 

TIP: Ask for a patio view table outside so you can watch the fountain show. One should be available if it's not too busy. It will enhance your dining experience even more!

From what I remember, I've tried:

-Big Eye Tuna Pizza
-Kobe Beef Tataki
-Popping Spicy Crab Roll (pop rocks and sushi..unique combo..i didn't come here for rolls, but this is a must try..i love it!) 
-Braised Kobe Beef Short Ribs
-Kobe Beef Flat Iron
-16oz Vintage Ribeye
-Potato Puree

Every choice was amazing. I can't put into words how awesome each food item was. I could randomly choose any item on the menu and be confident that it would be of superb quality. Thanks Yellowtail @Bellagio, I am glad to be a return customer and will definitely be back!

We walked from Vdara to eat at Bellogio. We thought that we will go to eat at Olive (in Bellogio also) but I am Asian. I decided to go for Japanese. The Tuna pizza was so disappointed only one is good was seaweed salad. Service is so slow compared to other restaurants in Vegas.

Some of the best sushi I've had in Las Vegas. To counter some of the subpar reviews, especially on account of the price, I have to say:welcome to Las Vegas. Yellowtail is in the Bellagio. The Bellagio is known for it's exceptional dining scene. This will cost you. I don't think this fact should affect Yellowtail's rating. The quality of the food, dedication of the service, and ambiance make this a very solid 4 star choice.

VERY DISAPPOINTING FOOD QUALITY, PRICE AND SERVICE.  The Yellowtail restaurant Almost seems like it does not belong in the Bellagio. I expected better.  
My husband and I go to Bellagio twice-yearly just to splurge and stay for the spa.  The multitude of restaurants and Buffet is excellent and the price never bothered me, until now. 
The "dynamite" Seafood dish was a mush of mostly canned corn, fried old shrimp and chewy leftover scallop pieces  amalgamated in an overly sweetened mayonnaise sauce.  EXCEEDINGLY OVERPRICED at $32. 
For four small lumps of Kobe ribs, you pay $42.  Each refill of Coca cola was $5. 
Very limited menu overall. Sushi is average and again, OVERPRICED at about $7-8 a PIECE. The Japanese yellowtail sashimi was tasteless and rubbery, for example.  
But lets talk about the worst service for an over-hyped restaurant where the decor cost needed to be made up in what you pay for bad food.  Each dish came out within 20min of each other.  Each person at my table waited and watched as the other person finished his meal.   Waiter said he would bring our meals but never did.  My second drink came at the end of my meal. 
After paying $250 for a meal that deserved $50 I MUST SAY THAT THIS HAS BEEN THE MOST DISAPPOINTING MEAL, EVER!
If any person from management of Yellowtail sushi would like to discuss this further, I am happy to do so.

Service was top-notch, no doubt.  

Price-wise, I guess it's Vegas so when you go to a place like Social House or Yellowtail, you're going to pay way more than anywhere else.  Two glasses of wine, three rolls and an edamame = $100

I tried all the unique sounding rolls like the unagi & banana roll (not too banana-y, surprisingly good!), strawberry roll with spicy tuna (strawberry on top, great aftertaste), etc.  The portions were as small as a regular sushi roll and not the size of larger special rolls.

How do they not have a sushi bar?  Hmm that always seems fishy to me.

great service.. not the best i've ever had.. a bit pricey.. it was 150.00 per person for a party of 6.. they sat us by the window which had a great view.. the hostesses were really pretty.. oysters were great.. nothing else was that impressive..

First time there for a light dinner before going to Hyde. They have an extensive Sake list to choose from and attentively keep your glass full. 

We shared the Gyoza and tuna pizza which were both delicious. We each got our own rolls and they were good but not spectacular. 

The service is awesome, very polite, professional and courteous. The prices are pretty high even for sushi. It's a good place to snack but not worth the prices for the entrees if you're hungry.

Meh. Don't like this place so much. If I'm ever in the Bellagio and hungry, I will do one of 2 things. Grab a taxi back to the Wynn to eat or if my friends/bf are/is playing, go to the high stakes baccarat table to get my Asian food fix. 

Anyway, I've been here twice. Both times, I've had indigestion afterward. And I eat a lot of sushi, a lot of fish, so it's not just my stomach, it's definitely something here that makes me sick! 

Last time I went was for my 21st birthday. It was still a fun experience and I still had a great time, but there are just better places to eat in Vegas. I really do love their butterfish appetizer, it is perfectly cooked, melts in your mouth, and you just talk about how good it tastes for 10 minutes. They also have an Alaskan King Crab tempura app which is pretty good. It was featured on "The Best Thing I Ever Ate," but I think I like the Nobu version better. Anyway, everything else is just all right. Their handrolls aren't really handrolls... They should call them "tiny stick rolls" with one smalllll piece of fish in them. They taste good but it just doesn't quite cut it for me. 

I wouldn't choose to come here again, not when I can go to Okada or Nobu in LV.

I was really excited to try this place, but I thought it was just okay.
The Kobe beef plate was $32 - and not a big deal.

I ate here on a Monday evening with my teenage son. It was very easy to get to, just inside the valet area, and adjacent to the casino. Valet is no charge, tips only. 

My first impression of the restaurant was that it was upscale but very loud. My son wore a t-shirt and shorts and felt a little underdressed. He was the youngest person in the restaurant by far and he is 14 years old. Attire is definitely business casual to more formal. 

Our server was incredibly attentive and kind, and seemed genuinely interested in helping us have a great dining experience. 

The good was delicious . Being my son'a first experience with sushi, I ordered a cucumber salad, vegetable tempera, Cali roll and Shrimp tempera roll. We shared them all. The food was delicious! For the price I felt the portions could have been a bit bigger. Had the rolls been a bit lower priced, I would have ordered each of us our own rather than sharing. Our meal came to $75 with tip. 

One great surprise to Yellowtail is location. On a warm night, you can be seated on their balcony and enjoy the Bellagio fountains which are right there! After our dinner we enjoyed watching the fountains dance for about 30 minutes (2 shows) before leaving.

Ask to sit on the balcony, you'll get front row seats to the Bellagio water show. The sushi was good but not the best for the price they charge. Service is attentive and very nice. Overall good experience

Dined here with some friends the other night. We sat out on the patio and had a great view of the fountains during dinner. Appetizers and rolls were phenomenal. Had the big eye tuna pizza, dragon roll, pop rock roll, braised short rib, and a lobster carpaccio. We also tried a few of the sake they had on the menu, all of which were terrific and the waitress seemed pretty educated about each bottle. For my entree I had a flatiron with asparagus that was topped with an amazing teriyaki-like steak sauce. Couldn't have been happier with the service and food, check this place out next time in Bellagio!!

Beautiful decor, amazing ambience overlooking Bellagio fountains. The staff was excellent! I emailed manager Yoshi about food allergy and he was responsive and accommodating! Our sushi was made separately by the chef so as to not cross contaminate with gluten items in the kitchen.  The sushi was well presented and tasty with the gluten free soy sauce and wasabi.  Server was attentive and friendly. Will definitely return!

My friends and I loved this place so much we had to come back here again during our 3 day weekend Vegas trip.  The tuna pizza was one of our faves, and this was actually the first time I ever tried Uni (yum!!).  We also had some tasty drinks here, I wish I could be more helpful and remember the names of the drinks but they were tasty enough so you couldn't taste the alcohol, but not too sweet, and definitely refreshing.  I think it might have had something to do with melon??  Anyway, along with the food and drinks you can go outside to their balcony and get a fabulous view of the watershow at night.

My second time here was much better all around! I got the same lychee cocktail as I always get but this time I switched up the entrée and stuck with the sushi side of the menu. It was a much better choice. The ambience here looks fancy, and it's priced fancy, but one of my friends was let in with a bro tank and swim trunks which is much appreciated. 

Do not pass on the sushi roll with the pop rocks and crab! It was the funkiest, coolest roll ever! We had to order another one for the table because we liked it so much.

Had an awful meal there a few nights ago.  Started with maguro and hamachi sushi.  It was not even close to fresh.
Then had Alaska king crab tempura.  It was completely tasteless
Finished with a soft shell crab roll.  I don't know what the wrap was; it wasn't seaweed, but whatever it was it was mushy and the whole thing was just awful.

I obviously don't recommend.  Perhaps sushi and Las Vegas aren't a good match.

Definitely not my usual price point for sushi... I'd rather go to a steakhouse or something for the same amount of money.  That being said, the ambiance was pretty nice.  The decor was dark and sleek, and our server was decent (he did forget to bring us tamari, but other than that, great).  We could also look out the window and see a little bit of the Bellagio fountain show, and it was neat to see it from inside the building.

I also liked the sommelier.  She was able to take two different wine preferences (dry vs. "sweet!  I like Moscato!") and recommend something in the middle that would appeal to both types of palates (still a little too sweet for my liking, personally, but a good compromise).

We shared the seared diver sea scallops ("mustard potato puree, cherry tomato").  These scallops were cooked very nicely and were garnished with a smear of the potato puree, which was too sweet, and a roasted cherry tomato.  The only thing was... there were two scallops.  They were 1.5 inches in diameter and had been cut in half so that there would be four pieces arranged delicately on the plate.  For $23, I think at least one more scallop would have been nice.

Next up was the popping spicy crab roll ("cucumber, asparagus, pop rocks").  Umm, it had pop rocks in it.  How could we not resist?  This was really fun to eat and actually worked a lot better than I expected.

We also ordered the unagi roll ("cucumber, sesame seeds, eel sauce").  Eel is always good and this was no exception.  These rolls were all a bit on the small side though.  Actually, I could have eaten the scallops and the rolls on my own, and then I would have been full.  But that would have cost me $50+.

Overall, I wouldn't choose to come here, but this was a nice place for a group of friends to chill and drink some wine (marked up from $20 to $55).  Such is my experience with Vegas... I don't gamble.  Instead, I lose a lot of money whenever I dine out, haha.

I would have adopted our waiter Guy, and made him family. We were pretty trashed- and we got a gorgeous setting, he took our pictures on the balcony in front of the fountains, such amazing service!!! I paid roughly 100.00 plus a person for 3 appetizers and three drinks. This place is great if you have thousands to spend on getting a satisfyingly full dinner.

I didn't know this place was going to be so damn good.  I'm not a big raw fish eater or sashimi fan has to be great quality and it definitely is here.  The Tuna Pizza is WOW. we feasted and oh boy so good.
This place is expensive. But you get what you pay for. It was delicious with great service and very tasty food. The tuna pizza was fantastic!

Worth a trip for the crab tempura!
I love the Bellagio and I really think this is the best restaurant inside the hotel. It is very loud but you feel like you are in the center of everything. If you are lucky to get a table out front, the people watching doesn't get better. We must have had a lot of sake because that is all I remember...

Went here the other night. I'm not a big seafood fan...but I must say I loved the tempura shrimp rolls. Even tried the ahi tuna pizza, that was amazing as well. The cucumber salad was a nice addition to the meal. It's a little pricy for the amount of food you get, but then again it's Vegas, everything is overpriced. Our waiter was wonderful.

Everything in Vegas is pricey...Get over it, you are in VEGAS.

The scallops were OUTSTANDING, the duck warm app was fantastic and the roll was fresh and flavorful..

The food was great but what made the night was our server Thio. He was awesome!!! Gave great suggestions as to what to order and conversed with us for most of the evening. For sure a place that we would return next time.

I had a chance to try out Yellowtail last night for an event. 

I was actually really excited to try this place because the menu looked amazing.
I tried a few of the cocktails not exactly sure what the names were but had a cucumber essence, something with blood orange in it, a lychee one and the konpai?

The Cucumber Essence one smelled strongly of just cucumber. It wasn't sweet like some other cucumer drinks I've had in the past. It smelled like straight cucumber and alcohol. It was meh. The one with the blood orange was great! I loved it. It was sweet but not overly sugary. The lychee one was a little sweeter than the blood orange. Both great. The Konpai was really tart.

They had several dishes brought out for us to try. We had the big eye tuna pizza which was really good but small. Had a few sushi rolls that were ok. 

I did NOT like the Ginger Creme Brulee.

All in all, it was a good spot. Pricey for the portions but I would def recommend to try it.

Went here after a conference and had a wonderful experience. There were five of us so we went all out. We ordered a ton of dishes and while the "signature" or special dishes were the BEST EVER, the spicy tuna roll (which I think is a pretty basic staple) was the only let down really.

I tried the following dishes, and I have listed in order of how amazing they were:

1. Yellowtail Serrrano - go figure, the yellowtail dish was the best dish at a restaurant named Yellowtail. Thinly sliced with jalapeno and cilantro, the worst part of this was it was 6 pieces and there were 5 of us... dilemma.
2. Rock Shrimp Handroll - this was so yummy, I didn't even offer a bite to the others.
3. Big Eye Tuna Pizza - I'm unsure why others don't like this... it was delicious and a perfect appetizer.
4. Rock Shrimp / Tempura Alaskan King Crab - these were similarly prepared dishes but complemented each other well. When the Rock Shrimp would get a bit too sweet, the Alaskan King Crab balanced it nicely.
5. Red Dragon roll - I only got one piece of this, but it was the best Red Dragon I've ever had. I think the others agreed with me as... you know... I only got one piece.
6. Fillet Mignon Toban - sizzling and amazing. It comes out in a tiny skillet with the best mushrooms I've had in a while. The only reason it's this low on the list is because that is just how awesome all the other food was.

Now, the last two are the only two that we didn't finish, or I wouldn't order again:
7. Kobe Beef Tataki - maybe because it came out with the Yellowtail and just couldn't hold it's own. I really can't remember that much about it.
8. Tempura Veggies - run-of-the-mill like the spicy tuna roll.

I want to go back again and get a table by the windows so I can watch the fountains of the Bellagio while I feast on fish.

Credibility: I have an AOS from the Culinary Institute of America and am a hospitality major at Unlv.

First off, what a great location- no doubt a reason for the prices. Yes the drinks are expensive. Get over it, you're in the Bellagio

The menu is excellent, something for everyone and even adhering to the "meat heads" that Las Vegas attracts. Everything has a great deal of different flavors and textures going on all at once. 

My server was Guy B, absolutely amazing. Very smooth and attentive to our every need and expectation! He gave us great recommendations and wasn't pushy! I highly recommend him to anyone who wants great service! 

We were a table of two and ordered Tuna pizza, Lobster carpaccio, Alaskan King Crab Tempura, Rock shrimp hand roll, protein roll, and cup of chocolate, and Oolong tea!! 
The lobster carpaccio was great! Nice and light! The king crab tempura was outstanding- nothing like i have had before in terms of SUBSTANTIAL King Crab. Rock shrimp roll was good, I would most likely try something different next time. The protein roll is a must!  Cup of chocolate was a great twist on a classic! Banana foam is a nice touch!

All is all, amazing meal, amazing service! So why the four stars instead of five? Well I was looking around and it seems that We got lucky with our waiter! Next to us, i was watching a waiter pour beer into a class(not tilted) and it completely over flowed on the table. The waiter seemed to just walk away before he could watch the inevitable happen. Also, it seems theres a lot of confusion with tables, many of the food runners were making mistakes around us involving table numbers. Either a lot of the runners don't know the table numbers or theres a lack of communication.

Last words: sushi rice was warm- GREAT hard to find warm sushi rice anywhere! They are good with allergies such as Celiac!
Yellowtail had the best sashimi and a great choice of sake!!! I ate here around 5-6 times in my 10 day stay! Amazing!!!

Arrived at about 9:20pm on a Monday night and was quickly seated. That was the height of my experience. The waitress promptly took my order and then I didn't see her again for 15 minutes. When I got her attention I reminded her that I was still waiting for a drink. 5 minutes later I got my drink. I waited another 20 minutes for the first of the  2 sushi rolls that I ordered.  I had the Filet Mignon Toban and Red Dragon. Both rolls were average and I was clearly paying a significant markup for location. The rolls came out about 15 minutes apart. Overall I was very disappointed with the quality of the dining experience and would not recommend for service or food.

The sashimi I received was so so at best, service was decent. My expectation when coming to Las Vegas is to get the best, this was average at best. I've received far better seafood/sashimi and I'm from Chicago!

My wife and I decided to try Yellowtail instead of Nobu on Friday night 3/4/16 and it was a really pleasant experience.  We sat on the patio around 5pm and enjoyed one of the better rolls we have had in awhile which was the Protein Roll.  It was fresh and we enjoyed it enough that we ordered a second roll.  

My wife tried the Kumamoto Oysters and while they were a bit on the small side, she said they were very good.  She also ordered the Baked Crab Hand Roll and said it was fantastic.

The Japanese Yellowtail Roll Sushi was average and I would not order that again.  I have had better at Hole-In-The-Wall places for half the price.

They did have a solid wine list by the glass and my wife tried one of their signature drinks as well.  It's a bit on the pricier side.  Our bill with drinks and tip was roughly $200.  The scenery and atmosphere on the patio were also fantastic and made the mood.  Our server was also attentive and even helped us get a great angle for a picture.  We will return for sure.

Everyone should experience YELLOW TAIL at least once in their life!!  This is not a joke about "being" with an Asian woman.  I'm Asian, so watch it!  Seriously, remember the name AND GO!  I've been 3 times and the next time I go to Vegas I will be there again!

This is one of my favorite shush places to eat in Vegas! I eat here every time I come to Vegas!! Favorite sushi roll is their popping spicy crab roll! Their rock shrimp hand roll is very good as well! It is on the pricey side, but totally worth it! For a party of 2 we our bill averages 100, without any cocktails!
Amazing everything! The food was phenomenal, the service was excellent; and if you're lucky enough to sit on the patio... The view is just fantastic. Spend the money and enjoy the meal.

Terrible experience at this Sushi restaurant We attempted to eat here Friday night. We had a group of 6. We sat for 45mins with no food. The waiter did not even stop by to apologize for the delay and offer more drinks  and appetizers to tide us over. When we asked to speak with the manger he was not remorseful at all for the poor service. I would never eat here again. I would expect MUCH more for a Vegas establishment in Ceasars that serves $25 rolls and a robata grill.

Great Service, 4shizzle...however for such a price the Food and the menu is lacking some imagination and wow factor. That's why I took away one star. For a group setting, very nice...as an individual eater and looking to load up on some top quality sushi find a better match. 
We had a party of 7 and we dropped over $2K. That's with drinks, maybe one 2 many drinks)))

Located in the Bellagio, sitting by the windows at night affords you gorgeous views of the fountains and the "Eiffel Tower" across the street. We had dinner at Yellowtail prior to the O show at the Bellagio (magnificent show, highly recommend). We decided to order a few small plates instead of entrees and settled on the tuna pizza with truffle oil (my favorite dish), the new salmon (second favorite dish, quite delicate and fresh), crab handrolls (too saucy), and a crispy rice dish (also too saucy). Overall the food was quite good, though the freshness of the fish seemed to be lost in the sauce. We also ordered a bottle of unfiltered sake which was fine, though definitely overpriced for the quality. If you want a nice meal in Vegas with good ambience and service and dont have a budget, Yellowtail is worth a try. Otherwise, there's better Japanese food off strip.

Japanese Fusion Place. It was noisy, actually really noisy as we were sitting by some loud chatterboxes...

Alaskian Tempura: $23; this was pretty good. Small portion but good.

Seafood Hot Plate: Yuck...too oily and creamy. 


Tako: cut off bumps, chewier

Halibut Sashami: 2 small pieces and they were okay

Baked Crab Roll: TONS of mayo...nothing special and it felt like I was eating a California Roll but with MORE, MORE mayo. 

The only thing that was really good was the tempura. Other than was average.

Let's see, it's extremely hard to order because it is so dark in there, you can barely read the menu (literally had to use my lighter, and I'm 31 with perfect vision). It is loud, and not in a good way; sounds like you are in the kitchen.
I'm not stingy when it comes to fancy dining, especially Vegas; I know you pay a lot for a little in places like this, but this place is ridiculous! The portions are so small, its hard to share something with even two people (and we had 10), so if everyone wanted to try something, we had to place 5 orders for it!!$ 
The waiter came by every now and then, and had to yell over the ambient noise; AND forgot either a drink or menu item more than a couple times.  
As for the food...eh. Although the fish/shellfish in the apps tasted extremely fresh, it seems as though everything was drenched in truffle oil to make it seem fancy [hire a new head chef]. The rolls were about the size of my index finger, so tasting the fish/ingredients over the rice they were rolled in was a task.
